Sentencas: A series of ceria-based composite materials consisting of samaria doped ceria (SDC) and binary carbonates(Li2CO3-Na2CO3) were examined as functional electrolytes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: DTA and SEM techniques were applied to characterize the phase- and micro-structural properties of the composite materials.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: Conductivity measurements were carried on the composite electrolytes with a.c. impedance in air.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: A transition of ionic conductivity with temperature was occurred among all samples with different carbonate content, which related to the interface phase.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: Single cells based on the composite electrolytes, NiO as anode and lithiated NiO as cathode, were fabricated by a simple dry-pressing process and tested at 400-600 degrees C.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: The maximum output power at 600 degrees C increased with the carbonate content in the composite electrolytes, and reached the maximum at 25 wt.%, then decreased.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: Similar trend has also shown at 500 degrees C, but the maximum was obtained at 20wt.%.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: The best performances of 1085 mW cm(-2) at 600 degrees C and 690 mW cm(-2) at 500 degrees C were achieved for the composite electrolytes containing 25 and 20 wt.% carbonates, respectively.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: During fuel cell operation, it found that the SDC-carbonate composites are co-ionic (O2-/H+) conductors.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: At lower carbonate contents, both oxide-ion and proton conductions were significant, when the content increased to 20-35 wt.%, proton conduction dominated.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes

Sentencas: The detailed conduction mechanism in these composites needs further investigation.
Titulo: Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes
Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes
Development of novel low-temperature SOFCs with co-ionic conducting SDC-carbonate composite electrolytes
